pullRequest.body:
This adds the [Woodbury Identity](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Woodbury_matrix_identity).

[Zulip discussion](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Woodbury.20identity/near/462245284)

Also corrects some bad deprecations introduced in #16590, which affected development of this PR.

Co-authored-by: Mohanad Ahmad

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [d51e3a90ee](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16325/commits/d51e3a90ee43c1ef6b0d9cda69e0d75395f1ebd8)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Data.Matrix.Invertible | 803 | 805 | +2 (+0.25%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Data.Matrix.Invertible`|2|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ add_mul_mul_invOf_mul_eq_one`
`+ add_mul_mul_invOf_mul_eq_one'`
`+ add_mul_mul_inv_eq_sub`
`+ invOf_add_mul_mul`
`+ invertibleAddMulMul`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

> Can you add spaces around every `*`?

I commented above that I think this reduces clarity in these long expressions; if you disagree, maybe we should take this to Zulip?
I don't have very strong opinions either way but, given that you are willfully distancing yourself from the standard, you should record that choice in a comment somewhere near the lemmas
Is this fine? I added the spaces in `Nonsingularinverse` since I don't think it affects clarity there, and I added a comment in `Invertible`

maintainer merge

Let's let another maintainer take the final look.
Thanks for your work here @4hma4d!
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by eric-wieser.

Thanks!

bors merge

Build failed:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11034500214/job/30648193233)

Can you please merge master and fix the problem? I think it is just something that is now deprecated.

bors d+

:v: 4hma4d can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11044992955/job/30681859650)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11044992955/job/30681859771)
Can you add spaces around every `*`?
Can you add spaces around every `*`?

```suggestion
variable [Invertible A] [Invertible C] [Invertible (C⁻¹ + V * A⁻¹* U)]
```

```suggestion
lemma add_mul_mul_inv_mul_eq_one: (A + U * C * V) * (A⁻¹ - A⁻¹ * U * (C⁻¹ + V * A⁻¹ * U)⁻¹ * V * A⁻¹) = 1 := by
```
Can you also properly space out the rest of the proof?
I think it might be worth deviating from the "spaces aroung `*`" style here, and only adding them around the additive operators.
This doesn't seem like it should be `noncomputable`, particularly when you already constructed the explicit inverse. Are you missing some `DecidableEq` instance?
The issue is that `add_mul_mul_inv_mul_eq_one` uses the noncomputable `⁻¹` (which incurs `Ring.inverse`) instea dof the computable `⅟`. Changing to the latter will make this computable.

```suggestion
        rw [sub_right_inj, Matrix.add_mul, Matrix.add_mul, Matrix.add_mul]
```

Can you restate this to use `⅟` instead of `⁻¹`?
```suggestion
variable [Invertible A] [Invertible C] [Invertible (⅟C + V * ⅟A * U)]
```
I think this would alllow it to generalize to matrices over non-commutative rings; and this would fix @vihdzp's `noncomputable` comment below.

The proof goes through as
```lean
variable [Invertible A] [Invertible C] [Invertible (⅟C + V * ⅟A* U)]

lemma add_mul_mul_invOf_mul_eq_one : (A+U*C*V)*(⅟A-⅟A*U*⅟(⅟C+V*⅟A*U)*V*⅟A) = 1 := by
  calc
      (A+U*C*V)*(⅟A-⅟A*U*⅟(⅟C+V*⅟A*U)*V*⅟A)
      _ = A*⅟A-A*⅟A*U*⅟(⅟C+V*⅟A*U)*V*⅟A+U*C*V*⅟A-U*C*V*⅟A*U*⅟(⅟C+V*⅟A*U)*V*⅟A := by
        simp_rw [add_sub_assoc, Matrix.add_mul, Matrix.mul_sub, Matrix.mul_assoc]
      _ = (1+U*C*V*⅟A)-(U*⅟(⅟C+V*⅟A*U)*V*⅟A+U*C*V*⅟A*U*⅟(⅟C+V*⅟A*U)*V*⅟A) := by
        rw [mul_invOf_self, Matrix.one_mul]
        abel
      _ = 1+U*C*V*⅟A-(U+U*C*V*⅟A*U)*⅟(⅟C+V*⅟A*U)*V*⅟A := by
        rw [sub_right_inj, Matrix.add_mul, Matrix.add_mul, Matrix.add_mul]
      _ = 1+U*C*V*⅟A-U*C*(⅟C+V*⅟A*U)*⅟(⅟C+V*⅟A*U)*V*⅟A := by
        congr
        simp only [Matrix.mul_add, Matrix.mul_mul_invOf_self_cancel, ← Matrix.mul_assoc]
      _ = 1 := by
        rw [Matrix.mul_mul_invOf_self_cancel]
        abel
```
which is essentially the original proof with some lemma renames (though you'll need to fix the deprecation warnings that appear after #16590)
Can you move this to `Matrix/Invertible.lean`, and generalize it from `CommRing` to `Ring`?
Should i move all of it or just this lemma?
Yes, all the lemmas currently in this PR. The lemma I suggest below about `inv` would remain in this file.
@4hma4d, do you want me to do the move for you? Happy to do so to get this PR over the line, but don't want to tread on your toes.
Sorry for the delay. I didn't move `add_mul_mul_inv` since it relies on `Matrix.invertibleOfRightInverse` which is proved in `NonsingularInverse`

> I didn't move `add_mul_mul_inv` since it relies on `Matrix.invertibleOfRightInverse` which is proved in `NonsingularInverse`

Indeed, to prove `add_mul_mul_inv` for the non-commutative case you have to repeat the whole proof, but with multiplication on the left instead! I've pushed a commit that does that.
Can you add a copy of this lemma that uses `⁻¹` and `IsUnit` instead of `invof` and `Invertible`? The copy should follow from the original.
Thanks @4hma4d for your fix for this; I pushed one more that did this a bit more exhaustively.
Please remove these spaces you added.
Feel free to add yourself as an author here, @4hma4d!
Thanks!
I copy-pasted this from your proof above, and tweaked it to reverse all the multiplications. Thanks for writing the original which made this relatively easy!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(LinearAlgebra/Matrix): Woodbury Identity
